RACE.RACE_TEXT: THISTLEDOWN RACE 1 6F Dirt CR: 80. Allowance Purse 31400. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since August 28 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since July 28 Allowed 4 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: QUARANTINA tracked three wide early, rallied in mid stretch, closed determinedly and was up in the late stages. TAKE CHARGE CHLOE dueled early, shook clear on the tun, remained clear in mid stretch and was caught late. SHE'S REDNECKER had good position throughput on the inside and finished willingly. TYRONA pressed the pace and weakened slightly. YEGUITA QUEEN allowed to settle, failed to menace. LOFTHOUSE raced between horses for a half, then gave way.

ENTRY.COMMENT: had good position throughput on the inside and finished willingly

ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, failed to menace,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: THISTLEDOWN RACE 2 1M Dirt CR: 66. Claiming Purse 18300. FOR REGISTERED OHIO FOALS THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since August 28 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since July 28 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $7,500.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SERENDIPITOUS set the early pace, was nicely rated on the front end, repulsed a bid around the far turn, drew off late under mild urging. MARVIN'S EXPRESS pressed the winner throughout, could not gain late but held place. KARAMEL CORN was never far back, angled out in the stretch and had a mild bid while no threat. NOTHINLASTSFOREVER had good position while three wide and lacked a late response. DAWN'S LIGHT allowed to settle, failed to menace. ACCURATE had good position on the inside and faded in the stretch. SAMMY DA BULL was pulled up soon after the start and was vanned off. The stewards posted the inquiry sign but took no action.

ENTRY.NAME: Sammy Da Bull
ENTRY.OWNER: R and P Racing Stables, LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: was pulled up soon after the start and was vanned off

ENTRY.NAME: Serendipitous
ENTRY.COMMENT: set the early pace, was nio on the front end, drew off, late unde

RACE.RACE_TEXT: THISTLEDOWN RACE 3 6F Dirt CR: 48. Claiming Purse 17400. FOR REGISTERED OHIO FOALS THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since August 28 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since July 28 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $7,500.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: AFLEET O ME had good position early, rallied in the stretch three wide, drew clear late under mild urging. FAST AS FAST CAN B set the pace with a clear lead, remained well clear in mid stretch and was caught late. YOU'RE OUT had good position while between horses, had a mild bid late and closed a gap. KETTLE KING allowed to settle early three wide and went evenly late. OXBOW'S RIDE was no threat on the inside. CANTRUNWITHBIGDOGS contended early on the rail and was through after a half. THE GOSPEL OF MARK showed little and trailed.

ENTRY.COMMENT: contended early on the rail and was through after half,

ENTRY.COMMENT: was no threat on the inside

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Catlaunch S. THISTLEDOWN RACE 4 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 85. Stakes Purse 75000. FOR THREE-YEAR-OLDS AND UPWARD ACCREDITED OHIO FOALS (WHICH REFLECTS $26,250 FROM THE OHIO THOROUGHBRED FUND). Foaled in the State of Ohio as per requirements set forth by the Ohio State Racing Commission. Nomination fee of $50. $262 to enter with an addi tional $488 to start, with a purse of $75,000, of which 60% to the winner, 20% to second, 10% to third, 5% to fourth, 3% to fifth and 2% to sixth. Weights: Three-Year-Olds, 119 lbs. Older 123 lbs. Non-Winners of $30,000 twice in 2023 allowed 2 lbs. $30,00 0 in 2023 allowed 4 lbs. Of two races other than Maiden, Claiming, Optional or Starter in 2023 allowed 6 lbs. Nominations Close Monday, September 18th, 2023. Starters to be named through the entry box Monday September 25th, 2023. A Trophy will be presente d to the Winning Owner. This stake will not split. In the event more than fourteen (14) horses pass the entry box at the time of closing of entries, preference will be given to those horses having accumulated the highest 2022-2023 earnings as published by
RACE.FOOTNOTES: RELISH THE RIDE was in hand early, rallied around the far turn on the inside, angled out three wide in the stretch, had a quick burst and drew off under strong handling. EXCITEMENT set the pace and dueled on the lead, was no match late for the winner but held place. FIRST SONG pressed the pace throughout and weakened slightly late. MANGA MAN was unhurried early and trailed, rallied in the stretch and passed tired ones while no threat. AUTHENTIC COWTOWN had good position throughout and had no rally. DR. ZARNETT settle early, had a middle move and flattened out in the stretch. ROMANTIC COWBOY raced mid pack and had no late bid. FIRSTHAND JUSTICE settled on the inside and tired in the stretch. VENTURE ON was no factor. DANES HEART was outrun.

ENTRY.NAME: Firsthand Justice
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled on the inside and tired in the stretch

ENTRY.NAME: Authentic Cowtown
ENTRY.OWNER: McDonald James H and Authentic Racing LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: had good position, throughout and had no rally,

RACE.FOOTNOTES: KHALFANI pressed early, rallied at the quarter pole, prevailed after a long stretch drive under strong handling. TUFF ATTACK set the pace and dueled on the lead, was outfinished late but held place. CALL WEST was unhurried early, rallied in the inside and closed fast. UNIDENTIFIED MAN contended on the inside and needed more late. UNCLEJACKOMO allowed to settle early, swung four wide, in the stretch and closed a gap. NO BANG NO BOOM (IRE) pressed the pace three wide and faltered slightly late.

FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $5,000 OR LESS IN 2022 - 2023 OR CLAIMING PRICE $8,000. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since August 28 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since July 28 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $8,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MASAI MAN had good position early, rallied in the stretch and drew even in mid stretch, drew clear late under mild left handed urging. OTIS OTIS OTIS was away alertly and quickly made the lead, was hooked in mid stretch by the winner, could not match strides late but held place. HAGLER was allowed to settle early, swung four wide in the stretch and finished willingly. MAKING ME CRAZY was unhurried early, and was no threat late. ZELIG chased the speed on the inside and tired in the stretch.

RACE.FOOTNOTES: CITY SIGNS pressed early, rallied at the quarter pole, drew off in the stretch to win going away under firm handling.
